This article introduces the new features, enhancements, and fixes available with this release.

  • For the latest Portfolio Analytics releases, see "Portfolio Analytics Release Notes Hub."

  • For the latest integrations releases, see "Integrations: Monthly Release Notes 2025." 

Contents

  • Product Updates 

    • All Lines of Business  

    • Commercial Banking  

    • Consumer Banking 

    • Small Business Banking 

  • Support Services  

  • Early Adopter Features  

  • Release Resources  

  • Feature Availability Columns Explained  

Product Updates 

This version of the Product Release Notes introduces a new version of icons:

Enhanced Feature

Fixes

New Feature

All Lines of Business

Click a feature link for more information.

Note: For fixes, nCino administrators can click the Product Development Issue (PDI) link to see the Known Issues entry for the PDI. Known Issue details can help you determine if the issue affects your financial institution (FI) and help you plan release testing, if necessary. Your FI's Community Administrator controls access to the Known Issues page.

All Lines of Business

Accessibility—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancement: nCino remains dedicated to the delivery of accessibility enhancements in accordance with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, Level AA standards.

Our Accessibility and Design teams made user interface enhancements to features to continue our WCAG compliance journey for this release. The features updated for this release are:

  • Covenant Management & Servicing

  • Customer Portal

  • Document Manager

  • Spreads

For more information, see “Accessibility Release Notes.” For quick links to relevant documentation, see “Welcome to the Accessibility Documentation Experience.”

< Back to feature table

Collateral Management—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancement: Administrators can now create the Override Amount Pledged system property to set Amount Pledged to null. 

For more information, refer to “How to Configure Collateral Management - Part One.”

Fixes:

This fix appears in Collateral for Visualforce (VF): Collateral Valuation mappings now accept formula fields and standard Salesforce fields as expected. (PDI-16876)

These fixes appear in Collateral for Lightning Web Component (LWC):

  • When the user adds collateral to a loan, the Amount Pledged field saves and calculates a value even if it is not in the Bulk Pledge Details field set. When the field is not present, the system defaults the amount pledged to the lesser of the two values: loan amount or lendable value. (PDI-17981)

    Note: Your FI might have configured a field set other than the managed Bulk Pledge Details field set. 

  • The Relationship Loans to Value Calc Config object now features a packaged LookupKey field to assist in migration between environments. (PDI-13225)

< Back to feature table

Document Manager—Global

Applies to: All

Fixes:

  • The Create New Placeholder API now correctly populates the LLC_BI__DocManager__c field for a Collateral placeholder. (PDI-18027)

  • When entering comments in Document Manager, users can now enclose text with < > characters, and the text displays correctly as expected. (PDI-15519)

< Back to feature table

Entity Involvement—Global

Applies to: All

Fixes:

  • On the Edit Entity Involvement dialog box, users can edit relationship fields, as expected. (PDI-9369)

  •  When a user has read-only permissions on the Entity Involvement object, the Borrowing Structure table does not display the Actions drop-down, as expected. (PDI-11960)

  • The Add Authorized Signer dialog box now respects the default value from the Signing Authority field on the Authorized Signer object. (PDI-18004)

  • The system now correctly displays the Capacity field help text when a user adds or edits an Authorized Signer. (PDI-13419)

< Back to feature table

Fee Management—Global

Applies to: All

Fixes:

  • The system no longer rounds the fee percentage values and displays the precise value in the Fee Summary section. (PDI-17918 and PDI-18012)

  • When users add a new fee to a loan, the system automatically sorts the fee list by creation date and places the most recently added fee at the bottom. (PDI-17164)

< Back to feature table

Form Generation - Global

Applies to: All

Fix: The Upload Document file link reflects the most currently updated file associated to the form template. (PDI-18134)

< Back to feature table

Matrix Manager—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancement: Administrators must install the new Data Download remote site setting to avoid an error when downloading matrix CSVs. If you have the Matrix Manager Named Credential, Connected App, and Auth. Provider set up and active, the system installs the remote site setting automatically. If not, you must configure the Matrix Manager Named Credential, Connected App, and Auth. Provider, and then manually run the the Configure Remote Site Settings feature process to install the remote site setting. 

For more information, see "How to Configure Matrix Manager."

Fix: The system displays a “No offers returned” message when the pricing matrix does not contain any active rows. (PDI-17753)

< Back to feature table

Priority Manager—Global

Applies to: All

Fix: Priority Manager number and formula fields no longer appear blank when a user attempts to save the record. (PDI-18778)

< Back to feature table

Rate and Payment Structures—Global

Applies to: All

Fix: When users add multiple streams, the system now correctly uses first payment date to calculate future payments when the Last Day of Month system property is set to true. (PDI-18546)

< Back to feature table

User Interface—Global

Applies to: All

Fixes:

  • Lookup fields in Input Forms accurately display field values and do not depend on REVISION_STATUSES translations. (PDI-18476)

  • Text formula fields on route edit pages now display complete content with proper line breaks and responsive sizing. (PDI-11443)

< Back to feature table

Commercial Banking

Automated Covenant Testing—Global

Applies to: Commercial

New Feature: Automated Covenant Testing (ACT) is now Generally Available for all nCino Platform customers. FIs can use ACT with nCino Spreads to automatically test financial indicators, such as earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA), debt service coverage ratio (DSC), and Debt-to-Worth against performance rules and available Spreads period data. ACT adds a Pass or Fail outcome in the covenant compliance.

  • ACT provides relationship managers and credit analysts with a streamlined and intuitive experience to accurately test and retest covenants.

  • Administrators can enable ACT, run feature processes, and configure system properties from Feature Management 2.0. They can select Document Sources and Spreads Classifications for Covenant Types, set FI and Financial Services Representative (FSR) options, and set the Spread Period Association Range (Days) value in frequency templates.

Note: Covenant Management & Servicing, Spreads, and nCino Standard Tags are prerequisites to use Automated Covenant Testing.

For more information, see "Get Started with Automated Covenant Testing."

< Back to feature table

Automated Spreading—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Information Update: The Automated Spreading permission set requirements have changed for FIs that opt into the enhanced Document Manager permissions from the 2024_10 release. Refer to the Assign User Permission Sets section of “How to Configure Automated Spreading - PART ONE.”

< Back to feature table

Conditions—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business, Mortgage UK

Fix: Descriptions and legal descriptions for Conditions are now translatable. To use syntax that supports translation, administrators must reconfigure parameters in the templates for Predefined Conditions with Parameters. (PDI-17876)

For more information, see “How to Configure Conditions.”

< Back to feature table

Covenant Management & Servicing—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Fixes:

  • For FIs that use Classic Covenant Management and custom statuses, the system does not automatically set the custom compliance status to Exception. (PDI-17973)

  • Users can now access the Covenant Details panel as expected, even when the Owner Id field is in the Covenant Details field set. (PDI-17921)

  • When using the nCino UI with the Covenants LWC UI, administrators can set the hideLoanAssociation=true parameter on the route to hide the Associate to Loan button when users create a new covenant on a loan. (PDI-17922)

  • The system correctly generates a Covenant Compliance record on a booked loan when the covenant meets all required criteria and there are no conflicting custom flows. (PDI-17835)

  • Validation rules now trigger on performance rules in the Covenant Creation dialog box, as expected. (PDI-17726)

< Back to feature table

Credit Actions—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Fix: In Relationship Credit Actions, the system now correctly saves comment formatting on Short Term Extensions when you create a new record. (PDI-18448)

< Back to feature table

Credit Analysis: Spreads—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Fix: Customer Portal users who use the Underwriting Bundle Cloner flow to upload their financial information no longer encounter an error message. (PDI-18235)

< Back to feature table

Credit Analysis: Template Management—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Enhancement: The Has Period Grouping field is now available in the Upgradeable Fields field set on the Underwriting Bundle object.

< Back to feature table

Credit Analysis: Template Migration—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Enhancement: During Spreads template migration, the system now migrates covenant compliances from the old period to the new period.

For more information, see "How to Configure Template Migration."

< Back to feature table

Credit Memo—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Fixes: 

  • Users can now click hyperlinks in the credit memo narrative. (PDI-17923)

  • Removed a permission requirement to enable non-admin users to autosave Credit Memo to Document Manager. (PDI-18342)

< Back to feature table

Credit Review—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Fixes:

  • When performing a second modification and a new review on a loan, the system no longer includes the original Completed/Superseded loan in the review. (PDI-16350)

  • The system now creates a new Review_Account record with account values that it captures during the review process regardless of whether the record has an associated product package. (PDI-16127)

< Back to feature table

Deal Proposal—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Fix: Help text displays as expected when users view or edit Deal Proposal cards. (PDI-18130)

< Back to feature table

Insights Administration—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Enhancement: Administrators can now use the Model Audit Log to generate period-based cash flows for more detailed analysis. The Cashflow View provides a comprehensive profit and loss (P&L) view and period-level projections for each income, risk, and capital calculation made by Commercial Pricing and Profitability. This enhancement allows administrators, project teams, and support services to perform Pricing Administration, troubleshooting, and validation independently, saving time and resources.

Consumer Banking

Credit Protection—Global

Applies to: Consumer

Enhancement: The system now displays this error message to an end user when it cannot provide credit protection pricing due to missing or incorrect installation (INI) files in AWS: “Credit Protection pricing details are unavailable due to missing or incorrect configuration. Contact your nCino administrator for assistance.”

< Back to feature table

Small Business Banking

E-Tran Portal—US

Applies to: Small Business

Fixes:

  • The system correctly maps the DUNS Number field value when the user sends for Pre-Check. To use this functionality, configure the LLC_BI__Duns_Number__c field for both SBEOC_Account and SBEOC_Account_Business field sets.

  • To support new SBA E-Tran requirements, the system now sends Principal information for all Operating Company types in the EPC/OC scenario.

For more information, see “Small Business Administration: nCino E-Tran Portal (US) Integration Getting Started Guide.”

< Back to feature table

SBA Data Guide—US

Applies to: Small Business

Fixes:

  • Questions 8 to 12 on the SBA Form 1919 now display correctly in the SBA Form 1919 Data Guide. (PDI-18363)

  • For SBA Form 1919 and SBA Data Guide, the system now masks encrypted Social Security and Tax ID values on non-platform encrypted fields in the SBA 1919 Form's Applicant Ownership table.

< Back to feature table

Treasury Management—US

Applies to: Treasury Management

Fix: When the Delete_TM_Snapshots_On_Finalize system property is set to True, and a user performs maintenance on a related record, the system deletes all maintenance-related snapshots, as expected. (PDI-17239)

< Back to feature table

Support Services

Support Service Offerings

nCino provides Support Service Offerings (SSO) to help you take advantage of the latest functionality. 

To learn more, see Support Services Offerings.

Early Adopter Features

nCino's Early Adopter (EA) program grants select customers advanced access to new and enhanced features. For more information about EA features, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM).

Now available to customers in the EA program:

Participate (US):

  • Access to the Participate integration where your FI can sell loans and manage post-sale activities.

  • Provides a route within the nCino loan workflow where your FI can prepare and transmit the necessary data to Participate.

Home Lending (AU & NZ) now includes the ability to:

  • Add fields to the serviceability assessment log.

  • Exclude debts from a serviceability calculation.

  • Unlock assessments with a new permission set.

Release Resources

Use the following documentation to successfully adopt the latest release:

  • Feature Deprecations 

  • Accessibility Release Notes 

  • 2025_02 GA Installation Guide 

  • Metadata Changes - 2025_02 

  • Permission Changes - 2025_02 

Feature Availability Columns Explained

Notes:

  • Blank rows indicate that what is new is a fix; feature availability information does not apply to fixes.

  • The following tables are grouped by line of business; however, many features apply to several lines of business.

Controlled by Feature Management?

  • "Yes" indicates that there is a feature toggle or feature process that controls what's new. Configuration may still be required to fully enable.

  • "Available with Feature" indicates that what is new is available if the parent feature is enabled or if the feature process runs automatically. Configuration may still be required to fully enable.

  • "No" indicates that what is new is not controlled by a feature toggle or process. Configuration may still be required to enable.

On package installation, is it visible or impactful to current end users of the feature?

  • "Yes" indicates that current end users (of this feature) will experience new functionality immediately after release installation (without configuration).

  • "No" indicates that current end users (of this feature) do not experience any new functionality after release installation.

Configuration Level of Effort

Provides an estimate of the configuration effort for what's new. For example, the Configuration Level of Effort for an enhancement means the level of effort to configure the enhancement if the FI already has the parent feature (unless otherwise specified).

Options include:

  • No config

  • Minor config

    Note: Minor config means that an FI administrator can perform this configuration; however, you can choose to request assistance via "Support Service Offering: Configuration Assistance."

  • SSO (Support Servicing Offering) recommended

  • Project recommended

  • API Implementation

    Note: This functionality requires API implementation by developer resources and is outside the scope of nCino Support. Contact your CSM to engage nCino Professional Services.

Multi-currency & Multilingual support?

  • "MC" indicates that this feature supports multiple currencies.

  • "ML" indicates that this feature supports multiple languages.

< Back to feature table
Title: 2025_02 Product Release Notes
Summary: This article introduces new features, enhancements, and fixes available with the nCino Platform. It includes a Feature Availability table for new features and enhancements.
